column4: DOes anyone know if there is a decent clipboard tool for Ubuntu that can live on my taskbar? used for storing a history of clipboard entries?
I think parcellite is quite nice, by the way. ;)
My opinion? Yes. But we shouldn't take polls. ;)
it only stores a max of 100 history items... i want thousands!
You could submit that for a feature in parcellite -- Unlimited. Meanwhile, if it does not do what you like, try other clipboard manager. :o
I have just installed glipper, is there any way to know what the binary file is called? its not glipper or anything that beings with gl
I don't know. I'll install it right now.
i cant see it in my applet panel
how did you figure that out?
Are you certain? Perhaps "killall gnome-panel" will restart the panel and you can find it in the panel applets.
